Name: Develop Academic Offerings
Documentation: The end-to-end process of designing, developing, and accrediting academic programs and courses before they are offered to students.

Name: Define Program Strategy
Documentation: Analyze market needs and institutional strengths to define the strategy and portfolio of academic programs.

Name: Design Curriculum & Courses
Documentation: Develop the detailed curriculum, learning outcomes, and course content for a specific academic program.

Name: Secure Accreditation
Documentation: Manage the process of obtaining and maintaining accreditation from relevant academic and professional bodies.

Name: Publish Program Catalog
Documentation: Finalize and publish official information about academic programs and courses for prospective students.

Name: Build Research Capacity
Documentation: The strategic process of developing institutional research capabilities, expertise, and infrastructure in anticipation of future research opportunities.

Name: Set Research Strategy
Documentation: Define strategic research priorities and areas of focus for the institution.

Name: Prioritize Research Areas
Documentation: Allocate resources and support to specific, prioritized areas of research excellence.

Name: Acquire Research Infrastructure
Documentation: Plan for and acquire the necessary facilities, equipment, and technology to support research activities.

Name: Educate & Graduate Students
Documentation: The end-to-end student journey from recruitment and admission through instruction, assessment, and graduation.

Name: Recruit & Admit Students
Documentation: Attract, evaluate, and select qualified applicants for admission to academic programs.

Name: Enroll & Advise Students
Documentation: Manage student registration for courses and provide ongoing academic guidance and support.

Name: Deliver Instruction
Documentation: Conduct teaching and learning activities, including lectures, labs, and online instruction.

Name: Assess & Certify Learning
Documentation: Evaluate student performance, assign grades, and verify the fulfillment of degree requirements.

Name: Confer Degree & Manage Alumni
Documentation: Formally award degrees and credentials, and maintain relationships with graduates.

Name: Execute Funded Research
Documentation: The complete lifecycle of a specific research project, from proposal development and grant acquisition to conducting the research and disseminating the findings.

Name: Identify Opportunity & Propose Research
Documentation: Identify funding opportunities and develop competitive research proposals and grant applications.

Name: Secure & Administer Grant
Documentation: Manage the process of grant award acceptance, financial setup, and ongoing compliance.

Name: Conduct Research Project
Documentation: Execute the planned research activities, including data collection, experimentation, and analysis.

Name: Disseminate Findings
Documentation: Publish research results in scholarly journals, present at conferences, and communicate findings to the public.

Name: Commercialize Research & Expertise
Documentation: The process of identifying, protecting, and transferring university-generated knowledge and intellectual property to industry and society for public benefit and economic return.

Name: Identify & Assess Commercial Potential
Documentation: Receive and evaluate invention disclosures from researchers to determine their commercial viability.

Name: Protect Intellectual Property
Documentation: Manage the legal process for protecting intellectual property, primarily through patent applications.

Name: Market & License Technology
Documentation: Engage with industry partners to market and negotiate licensing agreements for university IP.

Name: Support Venture Creation
Documentation: Provide support and resources for the formation of new startup companies based on university research.

Name: Academic Management
Documentation: The overarching capability to design, deliver, and manage the university's educational mission.

Name: Curriculum & Program Development
Documentation: The ability to design, review, and manage the lifecycle of academic programs and their constituent courses.

Name: Course Design & Management
Documentation: The capability to create and maintain the content, structure, and learning objectives for individual courses.

Name: Program Accreditation & Review
Documentation: The capability to manage processes for internal quality review and external accreditation of academic programs.

Name: Student Lifecycle Management
Documentation: The ability to manage all administrative and support aspects of the student journey from application to graduation.

Name: Recruitment & Admissions
Documentation: The capability to attract, process applications from, and select prospective students.

Name: Enrollment & Registration
Documentation: The capability to manage student course registration, scheduling, and academic records.

Name: Student Advising & Support
Documentation: The capability to provide academic advice, mentorship, and support services to students.

Name: Assessment & Grading
Documentation: The capability to design and administer assessments, evaluate student work, and manage academic grading.

Name: Graduation & Alumni Relations
Documentation: The capability to manage the degree conferral process and maintain engagement with the alumni community.

Name: Teaching & Learning Delivery
Documentation: The ability to deliver high-quality instruction and manage the learning environment.

Name: Instructional Delivery
Documentation: The capability to effectively deliver course content through various methods, such as lectures, seminars, and online platforms.

Name: Learning Environment Management
Documentation: The capability to manage the physical and digital spaces and resources that support learning.

Name: Research Management
Documentation: The overarching capability to strategize, fund, execute, and disseminate research.

Name: Research Strategy & Portfolio Management
Documentation: The ability to define strategic research directions and manage the portfolio of research activities and infrastructure.

Name: Research Area Prioritization
Documentation: The capability to identify and foster institutional strengths in specific fields of research.

Name: Research Infrastructure Planning
Documentation: The capability to plan for and manage the lifecycle of major research facilities and equipment.

Name: Research Funding & Grant Management
Documentation: The ability to secure and manage external funding for research projects.

Name: Grant Identification & Proposal
Documentation: The capability to identify relevant funding opportunities and develop compelling grant applications.

Name: Grant Administration & Compliance
Documentation: The capability to manage post-award grant finances, reporting, and adherence to sponsor regulations.

Name: Research Execution & Dissemination
Documentation: The ability to conduct research and share the results with the academic community and the public.

Name: Research Project Management
Documentation: The capability to plan, execute, and monitor the progress of individual research projects.

Name: Data Collection & Analysis
Documentation: The capability to design studies, collect and manage research data, and perform rigorous analysis.

Name: Publication & Scholarly Communication
Documentation: The capability to prepare and publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals and other scholarly outlets.

Name: Knowledge & Technology Transfer
Documentation: The overarching capability to manage the commercialization of university research and intellectual property.

Name: Intellectual Property Management
Documentation: The ability to identify, protect, and manage the university's intellectual property assets.

Name: IP Disclosure & Assessment
Documentation: The capability to receive and evaluate invention disclosures from researchers for patentability and commercial potential.

Name: Patenting & Licensing
Documentation: The capability to manage the patent application process and negotiate licensing agreements for university technologies.

Name: Commercialization & Partnership Management
Documentation: The ability to build relationships with industry and support the creation of new ventures.

Name: Industry Engagement & Collaboration
Documentation: The capability to establish and manage research collaborations and partnerships with external organizations.

Name: Spin-off & Venture Creation
Documentation: The capability to provide guidance and resources to support the formation of startup companies.

Name: Academic Information
Documentation: Information pertaining to the educational activities of the university.

Name: Academic Program
Documentation: A structured curriculum of study leading to a degree or credential.

Name: Course
Documentation: A specific unit of teaching and learning within an academic program.

Name: Student Record
Documentation: A comprehensive record of a student's academic journey, including applications, enrollment, and grades.

Name: Admission Application
Documentation: A formal request submitted by a prospective student for admission to the university.

Name: Academic Transcript
Documentation: An official record of a student's courses, grades, and academic standing.

Name: Credential
Documentation: The official diploma or certificate awarded upon completion of an academic program.

Name: Research Information
Documentation: Information pertaining to the research activities of the university.

Name: Research Project
Documentation: A specific, planned investigation designed to answer a research question.

Name: Research Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funding body to request support for a research project.

Name: Research Grant
Documentation: An award of financial assistance from a funding body to carry out a specific research project.

Name: Research Data
Documentation: Factual records (e.g., numerical, textual, images) used as primary sources for research.

Name: Scholarly Publication
Documentation: A formal, peer-reviewed article or book that disseminates research findings.

Name: Intellectual Property
Documentation: Creations of the mind, such as inventions, that are protected by law.

Name: Invention Disclosure
Documentation: A confidential document submitted by a researcher to the university describing a new invention.

Name: Patent
Documentation: A legal right granted for an invention, providing the owner the right to exclude others from making, using, or selling it.

Name: License Agreement
Documentation: A legal contract granting a third party rights to use university-owned intellectual property.
